pullRequest.body:
I suspect that (simp) rewrite lemmas that create non-trivial proof terms cause significant slowdowns.

This fix helps avoid a slowdown in [lean4#6973](https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/6973).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [fa6f4db2e5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22160/commits/fa6f4db2e55f3bd9c69df63c4bc32320b72ab1a5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`- subtypeEquiv_apply`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/af84e67b-4259-41a3-8d3a-abd2944b9ace) for commit 9f01d605ce75bfbac4ef9e4164eab42347e8f1bf.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/37fad35e-c2e5-4335-bc50-7347d1a12949/to/af84e67b-4259-41a3-8d3a-abd2944b9ace) against commit f4084b19bfc93dfa43f54a16be771f883239b9ee:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Lifting.Right   instructions   -55.6%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-22.962‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-0.01%)|
|`lint`|-1.167‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-0.01%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monad.Monadicity`|-1.290‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-5.90%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Lifting.Right`|-21.384‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-55.59%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13458979633)
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/35985e8f-6c31-47ea-a69b-fd02e6b721c9) for commit fa6f4db2e55f3bd9c69df63c4bc32320b72ab1a5.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/28c31897-af00-4be2-87a0-2f49a054182d/to/35985e8f-6c31-47ea-a69b-fd02e6b721c9) against commit 6befc6324c7b99e0796033458fb10bfb730d6290:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Lifting.Right   instructions   -55.2%
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-24.1‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-0.01%)|
|`lint`|-1.469‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-0.01%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monad.Monadicity`|-1.290‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-5.86%)|
|`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Lifting.Right`|-21.258‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-55.23%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13663236185)
With the new `as_aux_lemma`, this is ready for review now.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Thanks, that's a nice win. Do you think adding a comment about as_aux_lemma is useful?
Also, can you clarify the PR description a bit: do you "suspect" there are such simp lemmas, or do you know now?

Note to maintainers: I have not verified the the generated simps lemma is the same.
maintainer delegate?

Note to maintainers: I have not verified the the generated simps lemma is the same.
maintainer delegate?

This will make the build fail, no?
```suggestion

```
I didn't mean to add this to the PR, but since it is a comment, it won't break the build.
:facepalm: Right!

pullRequest.title: perf: avoid proofs on rhs of simp lemmas
